scope="row" style="padding:.1em .3em; text-align:left;" ↙Tours style="background-color:lightgrey; width:33%;" 6 \- style="background- color:lightgrey;" ! scope="row" style="padding:.1em .3em; text-align:left;" ↙Residencies style="background-color:lightgrey; width:33%;" 3 \- style="background-color:lightgrey;" ! scope="row" style="padding:.1em .3em; text-align:left;" ↙Specials style="background- color:lightgrey; width:33%;" 30 \- style="background-color:lightgrey;" ! scope="row" style="padding:.1em .3em; text-align:left;" ↙Festivals style="background-color:lightgrey; width:33%;" 91 \- style="background- color:lightgrey;" ! scope="row" style="padding:.1em .3em; text-align:left;" ↙Other style="background-color:lightgrey; width:33%;" 27 |} American hip hop recording artist and record producer Kanye West has embarked on six concert tours and performed live at various award ceremonies and television shows. ==Concert tours== {| class="wikitable" width="100%" border="1" |- ! width=20 style="background-color: #A9A9A9;" | Year ! width=200 style="background-color: #A9A9A9;" | Title ! width=200 style="background-color: #A9A9A9;" | Duration ! width=20 style="background-color: #A9A9A9;" | Shows |- | style="background- color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | 2004 || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | The School Spirit Tour || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | March 16, 2004 - May 5, 2005 (North America) || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | 34 |- |colspan="14" style="border-bottom-width:1px; padding:5px;" | The School Spirit Tour was Kanye West’s very first headline tour, in 2004. The tour featured a collegiate theme. Not only did it kick off at Virginia Tech, it hit a number of college towns across the states—from Pace University in New York to George Washington University in DC, ending with three shows at House of Blues in West’s hometown, Chicago. The tour was opened by Dilated Peoples, and featured John Legend as the pianist and signer, along with A-Trak as tour DJ. Onstage, West paced in front of seven slim LED-screens, with the Chicago cityscape as his background. |- | style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | 2005 || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | The Touch the Sky Tour|| style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | October 12, 2005 - December 11, 2005 (North America) || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | 48 |- |colspan="14" style="border-bottom-width:1px; padding:5px;" | The Touch the Sky Tour was announced on September 15, 2005 and started off with a few hiccups, with West making changes right down to the last minute. West scrapped the Touch the Sky Tour’s entire lighting plan just two weeks before the opening show in Miami. The tour was completely redone by new tour designer Es Devlin just a fortnight before opening night. Following this, just days before West was meant to start touring, opening act Common announced he couldn’t make it, as he’d just landed an acting role. This left West with Fantasia and Keyshia Cole for his opening acts, although Common would appear when his schedule allowed. In the end, the stage show was accompanied by a six-piece string section and featured live video of the show projected behind the stage. Negative reviews of his music and character were projected behind the stage, and he wore six different costume pieces (designer blazers). There was UK arena tour in February 2006 in the cities of Manchester, Glasgow, London, Cardiff and Birmingham. Australia tour commenced in late March, early April 2006. |- | style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | 2008 || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | Glow in the Dark Tour || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | April 16, 2008 - December 7, 2008 (Worldwide)|| style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | 88 |- | colspan="14" style="border-bottom- width:1px; padding:5px;" | The Glow in the Dark Tour was West's first worldwide tour and also included his first truly extraordinary stage. The Glow In The Dark Tour crammed in more than 50 arena and festival shows in the U.S., Canada, and the U.K. before heading to Mexico and then across the Pacific, via South America, to the Far East and Europe. The tours opening acts were Rihanna, Lupe Fiasco and Rihanna. The concept pitted West as the pilot of a spaceship hitting a meteor storm, landing on a desolate planet of dry ice, and trying to find his way home through tracks from The College Dropout, Late Registration, Graduation, and latterly 808s & Heartbreak. With design again done by Es Devlin, in collaboration with Martin Phillips and John McGuire, the stage was transformed into a barren series of landscapes—one resembling a giant moon—and fantastical glow-in-the-dark features: a giant, glowing-eyed monster and a robot moved within the haze, women shimmered in gold paint for the track “Gold Digger,” and stunning multi-colored light sequences lit up the often smoke-filled stage. West himself wore sci-fi themed threads, glow-in- the-dark accessories, his signature shutter shades, and gloves. The performance tour was captured in the book of photography Glow in the Dark by Nabil Elderkin. |- | style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | 2011–12 || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | The Watch the Throne Tour || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | October 29, 2011 - June 12, 2012 (North America & Europe)|| style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | 68 |- | colspan="14" style="border-bottom- width:1px; padding:5px;" | The Watch the Throne Tour with Jay-Z was in support of the pairs collaborative album Watch the Throne. The concert had no opening act and featured the two performers perched on massive video cubes showing sharks, rottweilers, crows, and tigers in a sea of darkness punctuated only by cellphone lights and piercing lasers. “Attenborough BBC wildlife content and lasers” was the brief given to stage designer Es Devlin by West for the tour. Devlin used hundreds of laser beams to create a myriad of different frames to this alternate world of geometric shapes, cascading light, wild animals, and its stars: West and Jay Z. Their habit of playing the smash hit “Niggas in Paris” eight, nine, 10, or 12 times in a row quickly become the stuff of legend. They partnered up with Givenchy for the clothing and the two donned t-shirts and leather pants. The tour grossed $95 million, and became the highest grossing hip-hop tour of all time. |- | style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | 2013 || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | The Yeezus Tour || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | October 19, 2013 - September 15, 2014 (North America & Australia)|| style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | 45 |- | colspan="14" style="border-bottom-width:1px; padding:5px;" | The Yeezus Tour served as West's first solo concert tour in five years, and featured a man- made mountain, diamond encrusted masks, and a catwalk, it was this tour that had the New York Post reviewer praising “an extravaganza of music and theater that gives the world windows into [West’s] erratic persona.”. This visual feast was created through collaboration between set designer Es Devlin, West’s design company DONDA, fashion house Maison Margiela, artist Vanessa Beecroft, and more. This was the tour burned into memory through those full-face masks. This was the tour where Ye staged the reincarnation of Jesus and delivered sermons on the state of the world. The Yeezus stage set and concept—featuring a giant mountain that occasionally turned into a volcano, West wore a custom- made Margiela mask that obscured his whole face. West worked closely with Maison Margiela to curate the show, and his wardrobe for the Tour was composed of 10 couture pieces, 20 ready-to-wear pieces, and an exclusive pair of sneakers, as well as the famous masks. Onstage, Devlin had constructed a mountain, which was sometimes wreathed in flames, sometimes covered with women in long white dresses. At times it would split in two halves, or become a volcano. There was an iceberg, 12 nude-nylon clad dancers, and a catwalk, alluding back to the fashion show created with Margiela. The speeches also became a key part of the Yeezus show. |- | style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | 2016 || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | The Saint Pablo Tour || style="background-color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | August 25, 2016 - November 23, 2016 (North America)|| style="background- color: #DCDCDC;" align="center" | 41 |- | colspan="14" style="border-bottom- width:1px; padding:5px;" | The Saint Pablo Tour in support of The Life of Pablo featured a "floating stage" suspended by a network of cables. West spent the entire set hovering above the crowd, performing on the stage while audiences with floor “seats” mosh and listen from below. The show took more than eight months of planning as he traveled across the world to get insights from some of the best stage designers. |} ==Concert residencies== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" width=100% |- !align="left" valign="top" width="30"| Dates !align="left" valign="top" width="150"| Location !align="left" valign="top" width="30"| Shows !align="left" valign="top" width="150"| Country !align="left" valign="top" width="700"| Notes |- | March 7–10, 2015 | Louis Vuitton Foundation | 4 | France | The funds raised went to two charity associations: "Nos quartiers ont des talents" and Donda’s House. |- | July 6–7, 2012 | Revel Casino Hotel Atlantic City | 2 | United States | West played two exclusive shows at Atlantic City's Revel Resort and Casino's Ovation Hall in time for the opening of its 40,000-square- foot HQ Nightclub. The performance was divided into three acts. Pusha T was the only guest, coming out during "Runaway" on the first night, and "New God Flow" on the second night. |- | December 28–30, 2012 |Revel Casino Hotel Atlantic City | 4 | United States | The performances featured widescreen projections of nature scenes, which also served as interludes with their sound effects. He wore two masks a diamond encrusted one and a yeti one. Elsewhere, he announced publicly that his partner Kim Kardashian was pregnant. |} ==Promotional concerts== {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%;" |- ! style="width:20px; background:darkGrey;"| Year ! style="width:200px; background:darkGrey;"| Title ! style="width:200px; background:darkGrey;"| Duration ! style="width:20px; background:darkGrey;"| Shows |- style="text- align:center; background:#dcdcdc;" || 2015 || style="background:#dcdcdc; text- align:center;"| 808s & Heartbreak at the Hollywood Bowl || style="background:#dcdcdc; text-align:center;"| September 25, 2015 – September 26, 2015 (Los Angeles, California) || style="background:#dcdcdc; text- align:center;"| 2 |- |colspan="14" style="border-bottom-width:1px; padding:5px;" | 808s & Heartbreak at the Hollywood Bowl was a two-day event hosted by Kanye West on September 25 and September 26, 2015. It was a concert where West performed the entirety of his fourth studio album, 808s & Heartbreak (2008) at the Hollywood Bowl in Los Angeles, California. |} ==Performances at festivals== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- ! style="width:12%;"|Date ! style="width:20%;"|Event ! style="width:10%;"|Country ! There were massive complications with the stage setup. He performed “Can’t Tell Me Nothing”, “I Don’t Like Remix”, “All Day.” and “Black Skinhead”. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | May 9, 2015 !scope="row"| Wango Tango | United States | | style="text-align:center;"| |- | May 16, 2015 !scope="row"| Power 106 Powerhouse | United States | | style="text-align:center;"| |- | June 20, 2015 !scope="row"| Atlanta Birthday Bash | United States | 2 Chainz came out to perform "Mercy" and "Birthday Song" | style="text-align:center;"| |- | June 27, 2015 !scope="row"| Glastonbury Festival | United Kingdom | West became the second rapper after Jay-Z in 2009 to headline the festival. Over 100,000 people signed an online petition to prevent West from headlining the festival. | style="text- align:center;"| |- | July 10, 2015 !scope="row"| Ottawa Bluesfest | United States | | style="text-align:center;"| |- | August 2, 2015 !scope="row"| OVO Fest | Canada | | style="text-align:center;"| |- | August 22, 2015 !scope="row"| FYF Fest | United States | West was only announced as the festival’s Saturday night headliner on Thursday evening after Frank Ocean pulled out of his performance. Rihanna joined for a performance of "All of the Lights" and "FourFiveSecond, elsewhere, Travis Scott came out and performed "Upper Echelon"’ and "Antidote". | style="text-align:center;"| |- | September 18, 2015 !scope="row"| iHeartRadio Music Festival | United States | West's first performance at the festival. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | September 27, 2015 !scope="row"| Summer's End Festival | United States | Vic Mensa and Travis Scott both made appearances on stage with West. Scott and West played "Piss On Your Grave" for the first time. | style="text- align:center;"| |- | April 9, 2016 !scope="row"| Paradise International Music Festival | Philippines | This was the first year of the festival | style="text-align:center;"| |- | June 6, 2016 !scope="row"| Summer Jam | United States | This was a last minute replacement performance as West was due to perform at Governors Ball instead, but it was cancelled due to adverse weather conditions. The performance was a G.O.O.D. Music showcase, featuring Big Sean, Pusha T, 2 Chainz, Travis Scott and Desiigner all on stage together. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | July 30, 2016 !scope="row"| OVO Fest | Canada | West was a surprise performer, he also teased a collaboration album with Drake. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | September 24, 2016 !scope="row"| Magnificent Coloring Day Festival | United States | West was made a surprise appearance and caused pandemonium with his arrival, he performed “Gold Digger”, “Can’t Tell Me Nothing”, “All Day”, “Black Skinhead”, “Father Stretch My Hands Pt. 1 and 2”, “All Falls Down”. and “Ultralight Beam”. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | November 1, 2018 !scope="row"| The Meadows Music & Arts Festival | United States | West cut his performance short due to an unfortunate family emergency. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | November 1, 2018 !scope="row"| Camp Flog Gnaw Carnival | United States | The first official Kids See Ghosts performance, West later tweeted that the festival made him delay the release of his album Yandhi | style="text- align:center;"| |- | April 21, 2019 | Coachella Festival | United States | West made an appearance during Kid Cudi's headlining set, later he performed with part of his gospel choir "Sunday Service" on a grass hill. | style="text- align:center;"| |} ==Performances at award shows== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- ! style="width:12%;"|Date ! style="width:20%;"|Event ! style="width:10%;"|Country ! Live from The Chicago Theatre | United States | This was a “Stay in School” benefit concert, sponsored by the Kanye West Foundation S.H.O.W. (Students Helping Our World), a charity organization established in the honor of West's late mother, Dr. Donda West. West’s Foundation S.H.O.W. partners with schools and community organizations to give underprivileged youth access to music production and academic support programs. | style="text- align:center;"| |- | September 11, 2009 !scope="row"| Jay-Z Live from Madison Square Garden: Answer the Call | United States | "Run This Town" (with Jay-Z & Rihanna), "Can't Tell Me Nothing", "Good Life" | style="text-align:center;"| |- | November 25, 2010 !scope="row"| Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade | United States | "Lost in the World" | style="text-align:center;"| |- | February 20, 2011 !scope="row"| 2011 NBA All-Star Game | United States | "All of the Lights" (with Rihanna) | style="text-align:center;"| |- | December 21, 2012 !scope="row"| 12-12-12: The Concert for Sandy Relief | United States | "Clique", "Mercy", "Power", "Jesus Walks", "All of the Lights", "Run This Town", "Diamonds from Sierra Leone", "Diamonds Remix", "Touch the Sky", "Gold Digger", "Good Life", "Runaway", "Stronger" | style="text-align:center;"| |- | December 2, 2014 !scope="row"| U2's World AIDS Day Concert | United States | "Power", "Black Skinhead", "Stronger","Jesus Walks", "Touch the Sky" | style="text-align:center;"| |- | May 10, 2015 !scope="row"| Chicago Bulls vs. Cleveland Cavaliers | United States | "All Day" | style="text-align:center;"| |- | July 26, 2015 !scope="row"| 2015 Pan American Games | Canada | "Stronger", "Power", "Black Skinhead", "Can't Tell Me Nothing", "Gold Digger," "Touch the Sky", "All of the Lights", "Good Life" | style="text- align:center;"| |} ==Other Performances== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- ! style="width:12%;"|Date ! style="width:20%;"|Event ! style="width:10%;"|Country ! Notes !scope="col" class="unsortable"| |- | December 11, 2004 !scope="row"| Grammy Jam | United States | West performed "September" with Raphael Saadiq, during an evening of performances by a variety of musicians, celebrating the musical group Earth, Wind & Fire in support of music and arts education. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | December 6, 2005 !scope="row"| Z100 Jingle Ball 2005 | United States | West was backed by a harpist and a string section during the performance. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | December 12, 2008 !scope="row"| Z100 Jingle Ball 2008 | United States | | style="text-align:center;"| |- | December 14, 2008 !scope="row"| KROQ Almost Acoustic Christmas | United States | | style="text-align:center;"| |- | January 20, 2009 !scope="row"| Youth Inaugural Ball | United States | West dedicated changed lyrics to numerous songs to pay tribute to Obama. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | August 5, 2009 !scope="row"| G-Shock The World | United States | | style="text-align:center;"| |- | September 13, 2010 !scope="row"| The Home & Home Tour | United States | Jay-Z brought out West during the second of two shows of The Home & Home Tour at Yankee Stadium. They two performed "Run This Town", "Power Remix", "Monster", "Can't Tell Me Nothing" and "Good Life". | style="text-align:center;"| |- | November 12, 2010 !scope="row"| 2010 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix | United Arab Emirates | West's first live performance of All of the Lights. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | November 23, 2010 !scope="row"| Secret Bowery Ballroom Show | United States | This was a celebration of the just released My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy, West performed the album in its entirety to a crowd of 575 people. Nicki Minaj, Rick Ross, Justin Vernon, Terena Taylor, Pusha T, and John Legend all made appearances. Tickets went on sale at noon on the day of the performance, driving secondary-market prices into the thousands. | style="text- align:center;"| |- | November 25, 2010 !scope="row"|Fool's Gold Records Third anniversary party | United States | | style="text-align:center;"| |- | June 9, 2011 !scope="row"| G.O.O.D Music Heineken Red Star Access show | United States | The performance was for the launch of the Heineken Red Star Access tour, an annual summer program that showcases music's hottest and freshest experiences nationwide. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | September 3, 2011 !scope="row"| Call of Duty: Experience 2011 | United States | Kid Cudi came out during "All of the Lights". | style="text-align:center;"| |- | October 24, 2012 !scope="row"| Samsung Galaxy Note II Launch | United States | French Montana, T.I., Kid Cudi, Meek Mill, Jennifer Hudson were in the audience. West brought out 2 Chainz to perform "Birthday Song". | style="text-align:center;"| |- | May 6, 2013 !scope="row"| Met Gala | United States | West debuted "I Am a God". | style="text-align:center;"| |- | May 15, 2013 !scope="row"| Private Adult Swim Upfront Event | United States | West performed the unreleased song "Awesome". | style="text-align:center;"| |- | June 20, 2014 !scope="row"| Dave Chappelle stand-up at Radio City Music Hall | United States | West made a surprise unannounced performance at Dave Chappelle's Radio City Music Hall gig, performing "New Slaves", "Jesus Walks" and "Gold Digger". | style="text- align:center;"| |- | January 31, 2015 !scope="row"| DirecTV Super Saturday Night 2015 | United States | West made surprise appearance during Rihanna's performance, coming out to perform "All of the Lights" and "Run this Town" with Rihanna, who then left the stage for West to do a ten minute set, before she rejoined the stage for a performance of "Diamonds Remix". West acted as hype man for several of Rihanna solo performances. The concert also saw the live debut of West's single “Only One”. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | February 7, 2015 !scope="row"| Big Sean Pre-GRAMMY Concert | United States | West performed "I Don't Like", "Blessings" and "Clique" with Big Sean, before performing "Black Skinhead" and "Can't Tell Me Nothing". | style="text- align:center;"| |- | March 4, 2015 !scope="row"| Secret Koko London show | United Kingdom | The show was announced only hours prior to the performance. West shared the stage with local grime artists Skepta, JME, Novelist and Meridian Dan, as well as, Cyhi the Prynce, Big Sean, Vic Mensa and Raekwon. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | April 12, 2015 !scope="row"| Armenian Swan Lake | Armenia | Armenian Police Shut Down the impromptu free concert after West jumped into a lake, causing fans to chase after him. He performed a medley of his greatest hits. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | April 21, 2015 !scope="row"| Time 100 | United States | West performed a 20-minute medley consisting of "All Day, "Black Skinhead", "New Slaves", "Blood on the Leaves", "Runaway","Only One", "Gold Digger", "Good Life" and "Touch the Sky". He started the set with James Brown's "It's a Man's Man's Man's World", and was surrounded by naked men covered in chalk. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | May 10, 2015 !scope="row"| Chicago Bulls vs Cleveland Cavaliers Playoff Game | United States | West performed "All Day" during a timeout in the first quarter. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | May 12, 2015 !scope="row"| Chance the Rapper's Open Mike | United States | West performed "All Day" and We Don't Care alongside Chance the Rapper and Vic Mensa during Chance the Rapper's closed-door open mic event for high schoolers of Chicago. | style="text- align:center;"| |- | September 25–26, 2015 !scope="row"| 808s & Heartbreak at Hollywood Bowl | United States | West performed 808s & Heartbreak in its entirety during two nights at Hollywood Bowl. The performance featured a full orchestral string section, background singers, an electronic band and 14 women dressed in solemn chador-style garments. Album guest's Kid Cudi and Mr. Hudson were present on both nights, Young Jeezy appeared the first night, Caroline Shaw provided background vocals for a bulk of the songs. The show elsewhere featured, constant fireworks, a large array of chalk painted men and a gold painted Zoë Kravitz. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | October 10, 2015 !scope="row"| Ramat Gan Stadium | Israel | The fundraiser was billed as "an afternoon concert" that was hosted at the Warfield—a 2,300 seat venue—with tickets selling for between $250 and $10,000. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | October 10, 2015 !scope="row"| DNC Fundraiser | United States | The fundraiser was billed as "an afternoon concert" that was hosted at the Warfield—a 2,300 seat venue—with tickets selling for between $250 and $10,000. | style="text-align:center;"| |- | December 6, 2018 !scope="row"| XXXTentacion Skins Album Release Party | United States | West made a surprise appearance at the release party. West performed "One Minute" for the first time, alongside "Black Skinhead," "Can't Tell Me Nothing," "Father Stretch My Hands," and "Blood on the Leaves." | style="text- align:center;"| |- |} ==References== ==External links== * Tours of Kanye West at Live Nation Category:Kanye West concert tours West, Kanye
title: List of Kanye West live performances
